definition: born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon

sentences.english: He was an unrivalled talent, but unfortunately at the wrong time.
sentences.chinese: 他是個舉世無雙的奇才，可惜生不逢時。

sentences.english: Building an expensive, self-indulgent new headquarters building just in time for the collapse?
sentences.chinese: 一個奢華的，自我膨脹的新的總部大樓建得生不逢時？

sentences.english: They complained all the time about their bad luck and not being favored by chances.
sentences.chinese: 他們怨天尤人，大嘆生不逢時，缺少機遇。

sentences.english: If so, perhaps they can blame the times that produced them.
sentences.chinese: 倘若如此，或許他們只能怪自己生不逢時。

sentences.english: Finally, complain god unfair, think oneself unlucky.
sentences.chinese: 到最後，抱怨老天不公平，認爲自己生不逢時。

definition: words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
